title: Why is recycling so important? The dirty truth behind our trash - ZME Science
summary: Recycling is a crucial way to reduce waste, offering environmental, economic, and social benefits. It helps in preserving natural resources, reducing energy consumption, cutting greenhouse gas emissions, creating job opportunities, and protecting wildlife. The article emphasizes the significance of the 3 R's - Reduce, Reuse, Recycle - and highlights various materials like plastics, metals, and papers that can be recycled for sustainable living.
green_innovation: FALSE, The article primarily focuses on the benefits and importance of recycling for environmental sustainability and waste reduction, rather than introducing significant innovations that substantially reduce negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: FALSE, The article discusses the practice of recycling as a method to manage waste and promote sustainability, which does not represent a new or significantly improved product or business process introduced to the market by a firm.
green_product: TRUE, The article extensively discusses how recycling and reusing various materials like plastics, metals, and papers can significantly reduce environmental impacts and promote sustainability throughout the product life cycle, aligning with the principles of green product design and usage.
green_process: TRUE, The article highlights the recycling process as a method to minimize environmental impacts, promote sustainability, and reduce waste production, aligning with the concept of green processes that aim to conserve resources, reduce energy consumption, and limit harmful substance release.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 562111 - Solid Waste Collection, 562998 - All Other Miscellaneous Waste Management Services, 562212 - Solid Waste Landfill
greenwashing: FALSE, The article focuses on the environmental, economic, and social benefits of recycling, providing accurate information on the importance of waste reduction and resource conservation without making false or misleading claims about environmental benefits.

title: Johnson Controls launches a partnership with Nucor to recycle nearly 100% of scrap steel at major Johnson Controls ... - PR Newswire
summary: Johnson Controls and Nucor launch a steel recycling partnership program in the US, salvaging nearly 100% of secondary scrap steel for repurposing as low-embodied-carbon steel, aiming to reduce carbon emissions and accelerate the adoption of near net zero steel.
green_innovation: TRUE Green innovation involves a closed-loop steel recycling partnership program that significantly reduces carbon emissions and promotes sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE This partnership introduces a new process of recycling steel and repurposing it as low-embodied-carbon steel, signaling a significant change in the firm's previous steel sourcing practices.
green_product: TRUE The recycled steel produced as part of the program aligns with the definition of a green product as it significantly reduces environmental impact throughout its lifecycle by using sustainable production processes and materials.
green_process: TRUE The steel recycling process introduced in the partnership program aligns with the definition of a green process as it aims to minimize environmental impacts, reduce waste, and conserve resources.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 331110 (Iron and Steel Mills), 562920 (Materials Recovery Facilities), 562998 (All Other Miscellaneous Waste Management Services), 335311 (Power, Distribution, and Specialty Transformer Manufacturing)
greenwashing: FALSE This does not appear to be an example of greenwashing as the partnership program focuses on genuine sustainability efforts and reducing carbon emissions.

title: GUNPLA (GUNDAM Plastic Models) Recycling Project / METI Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry - meti.go.jp
summary: The article discusses the 'GUNPLA Recycling Project,' an initiative led by four Bandai Namco Group companies through which plastic models' runners are recycled to create new plastic models, promoting resource recycling and sustainability.
